Article.ArticleTitle: Global hazards of herbal remedies: lessons from Aristolochia: The lesson from the health hazards of Aristolochia should lead to more research into the safety and efficacy of medicinal plants.

AbstractText: It took years of epidemiological and molecular research to demonstrate that Aristolochia, a widely used herbal remedy, causes cancer and kidney failure. This and similar lessons should inspire more global efforts to properly investigate the safety and efficacy of all herbal treatments. [Image: see text]
